text: Barbara Everitt Bryant (April 1926 â€“ March 3, 2023) was an American market researcher. She became the first woman to head the United States Census Bureau. She directed the bureau from 1989 to 1993. She also directed the American Customer Satisfaction Index. Her husband died in 1997; they had three children: Linda, Randal, and Lois, and eight grandchildren. Bryant died on March 3, 2023, at age 96. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Market researchers Category:Politicians from Michigan Category:People from Ann Arbor, Michigan Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Barbara Everitt Bryant
